resources.string: Always link to Google Play, even if the app does not come from there
Templates define how lists will be formated. You can create as many as you like, but you must have at least one.

A template consists of the list item (to be filled with app info), as well as an optional header and footer. All parts will be concatenated \"as-is\", with the item being repeated once per app. Supply newlines as needed. The following variables may be used in the item: ${packagename}, ${displayname}, ${source}, ${comment}, ${uid}, ${version}, ${versioncode}, ${firstinstalled}, ${lastupdated}, ${datadir}, and ${marketid}
Hi,\nseems like you find this app useful. Would you consider rating it? This will only take a minute of your time, but encourages further development.
Item format, may not be blank
Yikes! How did you manage to delete all your templates?!
Select the apps you want to list!
Whoops! Your list was too large for sharing

Annotations can be referenced in templates as ${comment} and may themselves contain other variables (${packagename}, ${displayname}, ${source}, ${uid}, ${version}, ${versioncode}, ${firstinstalled}, ${lastupdated}, ${datadir}, and ${marketid}). Annotations are kept when their app is deinstalled in case it gets reinstalled later.
